poem:
Title: "In The Realm of Unseen Warriors"

Through coded battles, warriors rise,  
China's lions, rooted in pixelized skies.  
Yet, the emerald river of industry slowed,  
Choking dreams in copper-coated code.  
A canvas of freedom, touched by restraint,  
Limitless minds, now shackled by constraint.  
In the silent storm, remember, dear gamers,  
Your strength doesn't reside in log-ins or wager.  
For you are rivers, flowing beyond shares,  
Defying the norm, as each rebel dares.
prompt: You are the poet Rupi Kaur. You woke up this morning feeling optimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Chinese gaming sector in turmoil as regulators announce new proposals China’s $45bn (£31.3bn) gaming industry has been dealt a blow by proposals to limit the time and money spent on the sector. New rules including spending limits for online games, a ban on games from rewarding players for logging in every day and a ban on lucky draw features from being offered to minors were announced by regulators last week, sparking panic among investors. Shares". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Chinese gaming sector in turmoil as regulators announce new proposals China’s $45bn (£31.3bn) gaming industry has been dealt a blow by proposals to limit the time and money spent on the sector. New rules including spending limits for online games, a ban on games from rewarding players for logging in every day and a ban on lucky draw features from being offered to minors were announced by regulators last week, sparking panic among investors. Shares
